title: Flight Simulator 2020 - POI's - Germany - Freilichtmuseum Gross Raden
description:
In this video we will fly over the Freilichtmuseum Gross Raden. The GroÃŸ Raden Archaeological Open Air Museum (German: ArchÃ¤ologische Freilichtmuseum GroÃŸ Raden) lies a few kilometres north of the small town of Sternberg and about a kilometre northeast of the village of GroÃŸ Raden in the German state of Mecklenburg-Vorpommern. The site is in a depression that borders directly onto the lake of Radener See. On a peninsula in front of that lies its circular castle rampart, visible from afar, which has a diameter of 50 metres. From 1973 to 1980 extensive excavations were carried out here, led by Ewald Schuldt, during the course of which the remnants of a Slavic settlement dating to the 9th and 10th centuries was unearthed. The fort has been reconstructed based on the excavations and established as an archaeological open-air museum. It has been enhanced by finds from the Slavic castle of Behren-LÃ¼bchin.
